RelatedSentence: LONDON ( Reuters ) - Three members of Africa 's youth club - Rwanda , Zambia and Zimbabwe - offer some of the fastest - growing working populations in the world , if only investors can capitalise on that .

LONDON ( Reuters ) - Three members of Africa 's youth club - Rwanda , Zambia and Zimbabwe - offer some of the fastest - growing working populations in the world , if only investors can capitalise on that .

If the countries ' demographic trends can be coupled with good education to create skilled jobs and an avoidance of political unrest , this should lead to economic growth quickly enough to attract portfolio investors , some analysts say .

If the countries ' demographic trends can be coupled with good education to create skilled jobs and an avoidance of political unrest , this should lead to economic growth quickly enough to attract portfolio investors , some analysts say .
None of the three makes it to the flagship frontiers stock index , which tracks exchanges a tier below the larger , more established emerging markets .

This is attracting investors ' attention , even though the precise effect of expanding populations of young workers on economic growth remains contested .

A0: Charles Robertson , chief economist at Renaissance Capital
RelatedSentence: I have never paid attention to demographics because I did n't think it could be relevant on any investor timeframe - I was wrong , said Charles Robertson , chief economist at Renaissance Capital .

A1: I have never paid attention to demographics
RelatedSentence: I have never paid attention to demographics because I did n't think it could be relevant on any investor timeframe - I was wrong , said Charles Robertson , chief economist at Renaissance Capital .

Renaissance recently published a study of frontier markets showing Rwanda - which hosts the African Development Bank annual meeting this week - along with Zambia and Zimbabwe as the top three countries for demographics .

Renaissance recently published a study of frontier markets showing Rwanda - which hosts the African Development Bank annual meeting this week - along with Zambia and Zimbabwe as the top three countries for demographics .
Each 1 percentage point annual rise in the working - age population should equate to a 1 point improvement in the annual growth rate , Robertson said .
In the case of Rwanda , demographics would account for an extra 4 percentage points a year on growth .
